title: Graziano: Don't be surprised if these 32 things happen, from an MVP run to rookies who could star
content: Jordan Love in the MVP mix? Emeka Egbuka leading all Bucs receivers? Colts winning the AFC South? We have 32 outside-the-box things to watch.

title: Ohtani takes big leap, earns win in 5-inning gem
content: Dodgers' two-way star Shohei Ohtani completed five innings for the first time this season, holding the Reds to one run to earn his first win of the season Wednesday night.

title: Staley met with Knicks, would've taken HC job
content: Had the Knicks offered their head coaching job to South Carolina women's coach Dawn Staley, who interviewed for the position, she said she would have taken it.

title: Townsend-Ostapenko ends in heated net exchange
content: US Open opponents Taylor Townsend and Jelena Ostapenko got into a face-to-face argument on the Court 11 sideline right after Townsend won their second-round match 7-5, 6-1 on Wednesday.

title: McLean spins gem, makes history in Mets' sweep
content: Nolan McLean became the first New York Mets pitcher to win his first three major league starts, tossing eight magnificent innings in a 6-0 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies that completed a three-game sweep.

title: Aces roll to 12th straight win on Wilson's 34 points
content: Behind A'ja Wilson's 34 points, the Aces continued their torrid August, beating the Dream 81-75 for their franchise-record-tying 12th straight win.

title: Messi's magic fires Miami into Leagues Cup final
content: Inter Miami advanced to the Leagues Cup final with a 3-1 victory over Orlando City on Wednesday night, thanks to two goals from a returning Lionel Messi.

title: Suns sued by minority owners over records access

title: Three Rangers with 5 RBIs in 20-3 rout of Angels

title: Maoists kill teacher in Sukma; civilian toll in Bastar region at around 30 so far in 2025

title: Hundreds Honour 2 Children Killed, 17 Injured In Minneapolis School Shooting

title: "Won't Let Anyone Take Away People's Voting Rights": Mamata Banerjee
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said she would not let anyone take away people's voting rights, alleging that the BJP was unleashing "linguistic terror" on Bengalis.

title: 14 Killed, 48 Injured In Mass Russian Drone And Missile Attack On Ukraine's Kyiv
content: A mass Russian drone and missile attack on Ukraine's capital, including a rare strike in the center of the city, early Thursday killed at least 14 people and wounded 48, local authorities said.

title: White House Fires US Health Agency Head After She Refused To Quit
content: The Trump administration confirmed Wednesday it had fired the head of the top US public health agency after she refused to step down during a standoff with vaccine skeptic Health Secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr.

title: Out On Bail, Rape Accused Kidnaps UP Teen To Blackmail Family

title: "If Indians Don't Budge...": Trump Adviser's New Trade Warning To New Delhi

title: "Mujhe Zinda Karo": The UP Farmer Who Spent 18 Years Proving He Was Alive
content: On July 30, 1976, Lal Bihari "died" in government records. He didn't know this until he applied for a bank loan to start a handloom business.

title: Man Assaults Friend Over Loan Dispute, Threatens To Remove Kidney, Case Filed

title: Shark Spit Out A Rat, Threw Up A Bird, Then Came A Human Arm. What Happened
content: Not very often do you hear of a shark helping solve a murder mystery. But it did happen nine decades ago in Sydney, Australia, when the giant fish vomited a human arm, leading people to assume that it had killed someone.

title: France Beheaded An African King 100 Years Ago. His Skull Is On Its Way Home
content: France has returned three human skulls, including one believed to be that of a 19th-century Malagasy King Toera of the Sakalava people, to Madagascar. This comes 128 years after they were carried to France.

title: Ahead Of PM Modi's Japan Visit, A Look At Economic Ties Between Two Nations

title: Opinion: Opinion | Not A T20, But A Test: Why India Must Play The Long Innings With Trump
content: The winning strategy is not to take a swing for the fences but to play a long innings by building a steady, unshakeable score. India must neither rupture its relationship with the US nor yield to pressure. The game plan is endurance.

title: How the Trump-Modi friendship came undone in five episodes
content: The relationship between US President Trump and Prime Minister Narendra Modi, once hailed as a bromance, encountered turbulence during Trump's presidency. Key disagreements arose from Trump's offer to mediate in Kashmir, a move rejected by India, and a canceled meeting during Modi's US visit in 2024.

title: ‘Trump a peacemaker’: Secret letter from Xi helps revive India-China ties
content: US President Trump's tariff war is inadvertently pushing India and China closer, focusing on strengthening trade ties after strained relations. In March, China initiated diplomatic communications, with President Xi Jinping expressing concerns about US deals.

title: Voter Adhikar Yatra: BJP says abuses hurled at PM Modi, his mother at Congress rally
content: The BJP has strongly condemned Rahul Gandhi and Tejaswi Yadav after a video surfaced from a Bihar rally allegedly showing offensive language used against PM Modi and his late mother. The BJP accused the opposition leaders of stooping to the lowest form of politics, crossing all boundaries of insult and vulgarity. The party stated that the people of Bihar would not forgive them.

title: Pulwama: Thousands attend day-night cricket match - watch video
content: Pulwama, once marred by violence and the site of the tragic 2019 terror attack, is now witnessing a remarkable transformation. The district is hosting its first-ever night cricket tournament, drawing large crowds and fostering a sense of community.

title: Interfaith land deals in Assam will need police approval, says Himanta
content: Assam's cabinet has approved a new SOP requiring special branch clearance for inter-religious land transactions, citing concerns about national security and demographic shifts. This measure aims to prevent fraudulent land transfers that could incite communal tension and ensure constitutional principles are upheld. The policy also targets NGOs from outside Assam seeking land, reflecting anxieties over changing demographics and land encroachments.

title: Microsoft protest: Company fires workers for breaking into president’s office; what’s next
content: Microsoft sacked Anna Hattle and Riki Fameli after a sit-in at President Brad Smith's office. The protest was against Microsoft's business links with Israel. The company cited policy breaches and unlawful entry. No Azure for Apartheid group demanded Microsoft cut ties with Israel. Similar firings occurred in April after another pro-Palestine protest. Brad Smith acknowledged freedom of expression, but lawfully.

title: Rajasthan paper leak: Sub-inspector (SI) recruitment 2021 examination cancelled
content: The Rajasthan High Court has cancelled a recruitment examination following allegations of widespread irregularities and paper leaks. Justice Samir Jain's bench delivered the verdict after a year-long legal battle initiated by candidates claiming injustice.

title: 'We should impose 100% tariff on America': Kejriwal targets PM Modi over US tariffs
content: Arvind Kejriwal criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi for allegedly betraying Indian farmers by removing the 11% import duty on American cotton, linking it to trade tensions with the US. He also attacked President Donald Trump for imposing tariffs on Indian goods and urged India to respond with even tougher trade measures, emphasizing the country's market strength.

title: Chess: Abused French transgender player wins national title; creates history
content: Yosha Iglesias, a 37-year-old chess player, has made history by winning the French Women's Chess Championship, becoming the second transgender player to achieve this feat. Overcoming challenges and online harassment, Iglesias defeated Women's Grand Master Mitra Hejazipour in the final.

title: AI researcher quits Meta: Reveals reason for exit; Says he followed Mark Zuckerberg’s advice
content: Meta's Superintelligence Lab is experiencing departures, including AI scientist Rishabh Agarwal, who left after five months despite a reported million-dollar salary, citing a desire for "a different kind of risk." Agarwal's exit follows those of other researchers, some of whom have returned to OpenAI, raising questions about Meta's ambitious superintelligence program and its ability to retain top AI talent.

title: Russia visa surge: Why 1 million Indian workers are choosing Moscow
content: As the UK, US, and Canada become less accessible, Russia is emerging as a major destination for Indian workers. With a projected labour shortage of 3.1 million by 2030, Russian companies are actively hiring Indians across construction, electronics, and machinery sectors. Around 1 million Indian specialists are expected to arrive, prompting new consular facilities. The Indian embassy has also issued visa fraud warnings, as demand continues to grow and the Indian community in Russia expands steadily.

title: SCO summit: PM Modi to be in China after 7 years; Putin to also attend
content: President Xi Jinping is set to host over 20 world leaders, including Vladimir Putin and Narendra Modi, at the SCO summit in Tianjin, signaling Global South solidarity. PM Modi's visit marks a significant step towards easing tensions with China after border clashes.

title: Musk & Altman’s legal tussle: Dispute over Meta 'chat' with Zuckerberg; OpenAI moves court
content: Elon Musk and Sam Altman's legal battle intensifies as Musk's lawyers attempt to block OpenAI from acquiring documents from Meta regarding an alleged $97.4 billion bid for OpenAI's assets. OpenAI claims Musk approached Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg to join the bid, which Zuckerberg declined.

title: 'People may still be trapped': Moment Russian missiles hit Kyiv neighbourhood - watch
content: Following a deadly missile and drone attack on Kyiv, which resulted in at least eight fatalities, including a child, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has urged the global community to impose stricter sanctions on Russia. He criticized those advocating for a ceasefire and diplomacy, accusing Moscow of prioritizing aggression over dialogue.

title: Stock market: Nifty50 below 24,550; Sensex drops over 600 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, tanked in opening trade on Thursday a day after 50% US tariffs came into effect on India. While Nifty50 was below 24,550 BSE Sensex was over 600 points down.

title: Argentina eases visa rules: Indians with US visa can enter without separate permit
content: Argentina has simplified travel for Indian nationals holding valid US tourist visas. Ambassador Mariano Caucino announced that Indians with US visas can now enter Argentina without needing a separate Argentine visa. This decision, formalized in the Official Gazette, aims to boost tourism and strengthen ties between the two nations.

title: 'Start dreaming big': Lovlina Borgohain to kids as she shares her struggle-to-success journey
content: Olympic medalist Lovlina Borgohain encouraged children in India's villages to dream big, regardless of their circumstances. Growing up near a tea garden in Assam, she overcame numerous challenges to win a bronze medal at the Tokyo Olympics. Lovlina's journey demonstrated that with belief and perseverance, anyone can achieve their dreams, inspiring countless others to pursue their aspirations.

title: Telangana floods: 1 dead, over 900 rescued, highways blocked
content: Extremely heavy rainfall lashed several districts in Telangana, leading to widespread inundation and overflowing streams. Kamareddy district received the highest rainfall, prompting large-scale rescue operations by the Indian Army, NDRF, and other authorities. Hundreds of people were evacuated, including students from residential schools, and traffic was disrupted on National Highway 44.

title: HP monsoon mayhem: Toll climbs to 310 — 158 rain deaths, 152 in road mishaps
content: Himachal Pradesh has faced a severe monsoon season. It has led to 310 deaths since June 20. Rain-related incidents and road accidents are the major causes. Extensive damage to public and private property has occurred. Mandi is the worst-hit district. Connectivity, power, and water supply are disrupted. Authorities are working to restore essential services.

title: 'Nuke India, kill Trump': Minneapolis shooter wrote chilling messages on weapons
content: Robin Westman, 23, opened fire at Annunciation Catholic Church in Minneapolis, killing two children and injuring 17. The assailant had messages like "NUKE INDIA" and others written on the weapons. Authorities are investigating the incident as domestic terrorism and a hate crime, focusing on Westman's social media posts containing violent diary entries and the fact that Westman was a former student of the school.

title: Google Maps detour turns deadly: Car with 9 swept away in Chittorgarh river; 3 dead
content: A tragic incident occurred in Chittorgarh district. A car carrying nine relatives was swept away from a river bridge. Three relatives, including a mother and daughter, died. A six-year-old girl is missing. Five people were rescued. The family was returning from Sawai Bhoj temple. They were using Google Maps, which led them to a closed bridge.

title: Blood Moon 2025: Total lunar eclipse on Sept 7; best viewing time & spots in India
content: Get ready for a celestial treat. A total lunar eclipse will occur on September 7, 2025. The Moon will turn a stunning red. This Blood Moon will be visible across India. The peak viewing time is between 11:00 PM and 12:22 AM. No special equipment is needed. Find a dark spot and enjoy the show.

title: Class 4 boy walks in on sister, lover in UP; strangled to death
content: In a shocking incident in Etah, a 16-year-old girl and her 20-year-old boyfriend were arrested for allegedly strangling the girl's 13-year-old brother after he discovered them in a compromising situation. The couple silenced the boy to prevent him from revealing their secret. The police investigation revealed the truth, leading to their arrest and subsequent legal proceedings.

title: B'luru stampede: RCB breaks silence after 3 months - What the IPL champions said
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) broke their three-month social media silence to address the tragic stampede outside M Chinnaswamy Stadium in June, which resulted in 11 deaths and 75 injuries. RCB acknowledged their silence stemmed from grief over the incident that occurred during their homecoming celebration after winning their first IPL title.

title: Pressured by ED to sign doctored statements during raid: Saurabh Bharadwaj
content: AAP leader Saurabh Bharadwaj alleges the Enforcement Directorate pressured him to sign doctored statements during a recent raid, claiming his original testimony was replaced. He accuses the LG of conspiracy and demands a forensic probe of ED's devices.

title: Every fourth IIT aspirant in 2025 prepared in Kota: How the hub dominates JEE toppers
content: Kota continues to dominate IIT-JEE coaching in 2025, with one in four IIT entrants preparing in the Rajasthan hub, and half of the top-100 ranks linked to its institutes. An IIT Kanpur report highlights Delhi zone’s best IIT admission conversion rate at 36.78%, while Hyderabad leads in total admissions. The findings underscore Kota’s unmatched role in shaping India’s engineering toppers.

title: CDC chief quits: Susan Monarez resigns weeks into role; vaccine policy rift with Kennedy
content: Susan Monarez resigned as CDC director shortly after assuming the role, reportedly due to disagreements with Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. The clashes stemmed from Kennedy's decision to replace vaccine advisory panel members with vaccine guideline critics. Her departure follows CDC restructuring, budget cuts, and concerns over misinformation, particularly regarding vaccines, within the agency.

title: 17 dead in Virar building collapse; builder arrested
content: A residential building collapse in Virar East, near Mumbai, resulted in at least 13 fatalities, trapping numerous residents. Rescue operations were launched involving fire brigade, police, NDRF, and ambulance services. The Vasai Virar City Municipal Corporation (VVCMC) will recognize flat owners as having "other rights" in property records, ensuring their legal standing in property-related decisions.

title: Assam land row: SC grants interim protection to journalist Abhisar Sharma
content: The Supreme Court has provided journalist Abhisar Sharma with four weeks of protection from arrest regarding an FIR filed by Assam Police. The case stems from a video criticizing the Assam government's alleged communal politics and land allocation for a cement factory.

title: Delhi hit-and-drag death: Minor driver’s sister booked
content: In Delhi, a factory worker died after a minor driving a car hit and dragged him. Police booked the minor's sister for allowing an unauthorized person to drive. The mother's role is also under investigation. The victim was the sole breadwinner and his wife is pregnant. CCTV footage shows the car hitting and dragging the victim.

title: Donald Trump tariffs on India: RBI to sit with industry stakeholders to assess impact
content: The RBI is preparing to meet with business leaders in September to assess the impact of new 50% US tariffs on Indian exports, potentially affecting over half of the $48 billion annual trade. Key sectors like textiles, gems, and marine products face significant challenges, leading to concerns about competitiveness and potential production slowdowns.

title: 'True fans will never do this': Shami slams trolls targeting Muslim players
content: Mohammed Shami, despite his stellar record and contributions to Indian cricket, has faced online abuse, particularly after the 2021 T20 World Cup. Shami dismissed the trolls, emphasising his commitment to the team and urging respectful criticism. He also refuted retirement rumours, expressing his determination to return to the national side through domestic cricket.

title: Hassett cites India’s ‘intransigence’ as US tariffs take effect; calls ties ‘complicated’
content: The United States imposed 50 percent tariffs on Indian exports. This action is linked to trade disputes and geopolitical tensions. Kevin Hassett mentioned India's reluctance to open markets and its Russian oil purchases. The tariff hike stems from President Trump's Executive Order. India is moving to mitigate the impact of these tariffs.

title: Himachal flood fury: Chandigarh-Manali highway closed
content: Heavy rainfall in Himachal Pradesh has triggered landslides and caused the Chandigarh-Manali Highway to close, leaving cargo vehicles stranded. The Beas River's surge washed away portions of the highway, prompting evacuations in Kullu district.

title: 'Love you girl': LeBron James writes birthday note; sweet message for wife Savanna
content: LeBron James celebrated his wife Savannah's birthday on August 27th with heartfelt social media posts, including a picture of her with a birthday cake. The couple's family page also featured Savannah, wishing her a happy birthday. The article further highlights LeBron's support for Savannah during her teen pregnancy with their firstborn, Bronny, when they were both teenagers.

title: ‘Money rain’ in UP's Auraiya: Monkey snatches Rs 80,000, throws Rs 500 notes from tree
content: In a bizarre incident in Auraiya, Uttar Pradesh, a monkey snatched a bag containing Rs 80,000 from a teacher's motorcycle at Bidhuna Tehsil. The monkey then climbed a tree and began throwing the currency notes, causing a 'money rain' and a scramble among onlookers.

title: 'Vipin set her on fire’: Nikki Bhati's sister stands by her statement
content: Following Nikki Bhati's death from severe burns, the UP Women's Commission visited her family, where her sister Kanchan maintained that Nikki's husband, Vipin, set her ablaze over dowry demands. Kanchan's testimony is crucial as police investigate Vipin, his parents, and brother, all arrested for murder.

title: Explained: What Tele-MANAS offers students and why CBSE wants schools to act now
content: CBSE has instructed all affiliated schools to promote the Tele-MANAS helpline, offering students 24x7 free and confidential mental health support in 20 languages. Schools must display helpline numbers and include information in assemblies and newsletters. A mobile app and video consultations are also available. Meanwhile, CBSE and AIIMS Delhi launched Project MATE, a five-day training for school counsellors focusing on adolescent well-being, resilience, and peer support as part of a broader mental health framework.

title: This common backyard plant could be key to reversing liver damage; here's how
content: Emerging research highlights dandelion root's potential in combating liver fibrosis, a condition leading to chronic liver damage. Studies indicate that dandelion root extract can prevent the progression of hepatic fibrosis by reducing oxidative stress, inflammation, and collagen accumulation. While primarily tested on animals, these findings suggest dandelion's bioactive compounds may offer liver protection and promote tissue repair.

title: 'Too chill, no growth': Ex-Microsoft techie quits new job in 20 days; internet reacts
content: A former Microsoft engineer's abrupt departure from a new job after just 20 days has sparked widespread debate online. Citing a lack of challenge and potential for stagnation, he prioritized growth over comfort. This decision highlights the ongoing tension between ambition and work-life balance, resonating with many who value continuous development over a relaxed work environment.

title: Gold & silver price prediction today: Gold rate exhibiting bullish trend
content: Gold and silver price prediction today:  Gold prices are expected to continue their upward trend, potentially reaching 102,450, supported by strong bullish momentum and global uncertainties. Silver is also showing strength, aiming for 117,500, driven by investment demand and industrial use.

title: Post surgeries bike ride to Kailash: What Sadhguru replied to R Madhavan's question
content: Sadhguru Jaggi Vasudev, recovered from two brain surgeries in 2024, is on a motorcycle journey to Mount Kailash. Actor R Madhavan praised Sadhguru's resilience, questioning his perilous journey despite his recent subdural hematoma. Sadhguru humorously stated he put his 'broken head in Shiva's lap.' He recounted a previous health scare and how Kailash transformed him.

title: 4 youths cling to tree, escape being swept away to Pakistan
content: A dramatic rescue unfolded near the India-Pakistan border as an NDRF team saved four youngsters swept away by floodwater, clinging to a tree. Simultaneously, in Gurdaspur, around 400 students and staff were rescued from a flooded residential school. Heavy rainfall across Punjab, Haryana, and Himachal Pradesh led to widespread flooding, prompting school closures and government relief efforts.

content: 2K Games has revealed improvements to NBA 2K26's management modes, MyNBA and MyGM . players can invite up to 15 friends or make the playoffs available to the public . most actions in these modes are simulated, and developers have invested time and energy in response to community feedback .

title: Catch up on NFL cuts, trades and final roster moves
content:
C.J. Stroud joins "First Take" to discuss how the Texans' offensive line has improved as a unit to protect him better in the 2025 NFL season. (1:13) The roster  cut-down deadline  for all  32 teams  for the  2025 NFL season  has passed. Each front office had to trim its active roster to 53 players by 4 p.m. ET, which means there were plenty of cuts, trades, practice squad additions and  roster moves  announced. Good news: We tracked it all for you. Here is the intel, including notable moves and what our reporters heard. There will be no more updates. Quick links: 
 Team-by-team list of cuts 
 Depth charts  |  Trade tracker  |  Trade grades 
 Fantasy football draft guide  |  Sign up to play

title: How Kelce has prepared for what could be his final season
content: the Chiefs star tight end is in the final year of his contract . he has spoken about his future with the team through only this season . "i can't go out like that," he says . the chiefs start their season in so Paulo next week .

title: Minneapolis church shooting: Robin Westman’s identity, deranged 'manifesto'
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world .

title: Travis Kelce unveils American Eagle collection with Azzi Fudd and more star athletes
content: a collaboration with his brand Tru Kolors and American Eagle will feature six athletes from across the sports world . the collection will feature more than 90 pieces . it's been a busy week for tight end Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift .

title: How the Fever and four other WNBA teams can clinch playoff spots
content: the 2025 WNBA playoff picture is taking shape . the top teams in the league are fighting for playoff seeding and home-court advantage . five teams, all within four games of each other, are realistically vying for the final three spots .
